title: Can Americans pull the plug on petrol-powered cars?
description: Joe Biden wants half of all cars sold in the US to be zero emission by 2030 - but getting there won't be easy.

title: The fiendish new trick cyber-criminals are using to evade capture
description: Bitcoin researchers discover a new darknet tool criminals are using to help launder their digital money.

title: How can new technology protect outdoor workers?
description: Working outdoors in extreme heat can be deadly, new tech and better protection for workers could help.

title: How anti-vaxxers are living and loving in a Covid world
description: Opponents of Covid vaccines are turning to online dating and house shares for the unvaccinated only.

title: Virtual reality: 'There's no max, there's no limit!'
description: "There's no max, there's no limit" to virtual reality, so is it the future of live music?

title: Afghanistan: Desperation as thousands flee the Taliban
description: Yogita Limaye reports from a camp in Kabul where thousands who have been displaced by violence seek refuge.

title: Satanic forums visited by a killer uncovered
description: The BBC uncovers evidence about Satanic forums visited by the killer of two sisters.

title: Afghanistan: How the Taliban gained ground so quickly
description: The situation looks bleak for the Afghan government, but there may still be a chance of a stalemate.

title: TV newsreader Victoria Derbyshire overcomes on-air shoe struggle
description: The BBC News channel presenter was seen quietly cursing as she struggled to put on her high heels.

title: Lawro's Premier League opening-weekend predictions v singer Louisa Roach
description: Mark Lawrenson takes on singer and Everton fan Louisa Roach aka She Drew the Gun to make predictions for the opening weekend of the Premier League season.

title: Life in a town taken by the Taliban in Afghanistan
description: BBC correspondent Secunder Kermani reports from a town in Afghanistan recently taken by the Taliban

title: Northern Turkey hit by severe flash flooding
description: Seventeen people have reportedly died, with more than 1,400 people evacuated from the areas affected.

title: GB Olympic silver medallist Ujah suspended after testing positive for banned substance
description: British sprinter CJ Ujah is suspended from competition after a positive test for a banned substance.

title: Nick Grimshaw on leaving Radio 1: 'I've interviewed everyone, twice'
description: The legendary presenter reflects on leaving BBC Radio 1 after 14 years.

title: ‘Not an Afghanistan problem but a humanity problem’ - Gen McMaster
description: This is a frontier between barbarism and civilisation, a former US national security adviser says.

title: The Papers: 'Spy sold secrets' and 'no way back for Andrew'
description: Thursday's papers report fears that a spy at the British embassy in Berlin sold data to Russia.

title: Tourist helicopter crashes into Russian lake
description: A helicopter with 16 people on board has crashed into a lake in the far east of the country.

title: Australian capital Canberra goes into snap lockdown
description: The one-week lockdown comes after Canberra recorded its first case of Covid-19 for more than a year.

title: Afghanistan war: Army chief replaced as Taliban seize more cities
description: General Wali Mohammad Ahmadzai has been removed from his post, as insurgents take more cities.

title: Cryptocurrency heist hacker returns $260m in funds
description: The hacker behind the $600m Poly Network cryptocurrency heist has posted a Q&A on the blockchain.

title: Lily Allen on making her West End debut in 2:22 - A Ghost Story
description: The singer is temporarily pausing her successful music career to star in a brand new play 2:22.

title: Boohoo boss: 'We're not a throwaway fashion brand'
description: The boss of fast fashion retailer Boohoo tells the BBC it is committed to being more sustainable.

title: Quarantine hotel rules face legal challenge
description: Travellers affected by the UK's quarantine hotel policy want a judicial review of the rules.

title: GCSES 2021: Higher results expected after exams axed
description: Pupils are finding out their GCSE results, as a second year of bumper grades is predicted.

title: New Zealand borders to remain closed for rest of the year
description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said her priority was vaccinating the population by the end of 2021.

title: Climate: WWF warns UK spending is lagging behind targets
description: The conservation group WWF says the UK government must keep its promises on climate change.
